japanese:
お兄ちゃん、五月さん！
早く早くー！
translation:
Big bro, Itsuki-san!
Hurry, hurry!

japanese:
そんなに急がなくても大丈夫ですよ。
時間はまだありますし。
translation:
You don't need to rush so much.
We still have time.

japanese:
いや、意外とそうでもないぞ。
そろそろ夕方だ。
translation:
Well, we don't have as much time as you might think.
It's already evening.

japanese:
あっ……！
もうそんな時間だったんですか？
translation:
Ah...
Is it really that time already?

japanese:
そりゃそうだろ。
お前らが勝負をして、そのあと勉強もしたんだ。
translation:
Well, yeah.
You guys had that competition,
and then we studied after that.

japanese:
そんな時間なのに、らいはちゃんは
これから何をするつもりなんでしょう？
translation:
Even though it's this late,
what could Raiha-chan be planning on doing?

japanese: キャンプだよ！
translation: We're gonna go camping!

japanese: は？　キャンプ……って、今からか？
translation: Huh? Camping...? Now?

japanese: それに、道具も何もないですよ？
translation: We don't have any equipment, do we?

japanese:
大丈夫！
道具なら……あっ、四葉さん！
translation:
It's okay!
As for the equipment... Ah, Yotsuba-san!

japanese:
らいはちゃん！
例のあれ、ありましたよ！
translation:
Raiha-chan!
I found the thing!

japanese:
四葉……。
あなた、何を持っているのですか？
translation:
Yotsuba...
What do you have there?

japanese:
じゃーん！　テントだよ！
らいはちゃんに頼まれて、倉庫から持ってきたんだ。
translation:
Tah-dah! A tent!
I brought the tent out from storage,
as Raiha-chan requested.

japanese: テントって、そんなものまであったのか。
translation:
A tent, huh?
We even had a tent?

japanese:
ありがと、四葉さん！
別荘の前にこのテントを張れば、
３人でキャンプができるよね。
translation:
Thank you, Yotsuba-san!
If we set up this tent in front of the villa,
the three of us can go camping, right?

japanese:
別荘の前……。
キャンプ感ゼロだな……。
translation:
Camping in front of the villa...
That's not very camp-like at all...

japanese:
けど、まあ、時間的に遠くには行けないから
妥当な場所ではあるか。
translation:
Well, we can't go far away because of the time,
so I think it's an appropriate location.

japanese:
それ以前に、まだ私はキャンプをやるという
事実すら受け止められていませんが……。
translation:
Well, I haven't even fully accepted the fact
that we're going camping...

japanese: ……正直、俺もだ。
translation: ...Honestly, me neither.

japanese:
（しかし、他でもないらいはの頼みだ。
　キャンプをしたいって言うのなら、
　とことん付き合うまでだが……）
translation:
(However, it's what Raiha wants.
 So if she wants to go camping then 
 I guess we're going camping...)

japanese:
（五月はどうなんだろうか。
　今朝からずっと、こいつの考えが
　いまいち読めないからなぁ）
translation:
(I wonder about Itsuki then.
 I haven't been able to figure out what's been
 going on in her mind since this morning.)

japanese: 上杉君？　どうかしましたか？
translation: Uesugi-kun? Is something the matter?

japanese: まさか断ろうとか思ってないよな？
translation: You're not thinking of backing out, are ya?

japanese: な、なんですか、いきなり。
translation: Wh-what are you talking about, all of a sudden?

japanese: もし断れば、らいはは間違いなく悲しむぞ。
translation: If you backed out, Raiha would definitely be sad.

japanese:
言われなくてもわかっています。
上杉君こそ、ちゃんとキャンプに
参加するつもりでしょうね？
translation:
I can understand that without you telling me.
You're planning on joining in, right, Uesugi-kun?

japanese:
当たり前だ。
誰にものを言ってる。
translation:
Obviously.
Who do you think you're talking to?

japanese:
そ、そうですか。
いえ、そうですよね……。
translation:
I-is that so.
Well, yes, of course...

japanese:
ほらほら、お兄ちゃん、五月さん、
早くテントを張りに行こう！
急がないと日が暮れちゃうよ！
translation:
Come on, come on, big bro, Itsuki-san!
Let's hurry and set up the tent!
If we don't hurry, the sun will set!

japanese:
わっ！？
らいはちゃん、引っ張らないでください！
translation:
Wah?!
Raiha-chan, please don't yank on me!

japanese: 四葉はやらないのか？
translation: Yotsuba, you're not gonna join in?

japanese: え？　私ですか？
translation: Huh? Me?

japanese:
ああ、お前もキャンプに参加すればいい。
こういうの好きだろ？
translation:
Yeah, you should camp with us.
You like this kind of stuff, right?

japanese:
いえいえ、私は不参加で大丈夫ですよ。
３人でごゆっくりどうぞ！
translation:
Oh, no, I'm okay with not participating.
You three have a great time!

japanese: いや、そうなると五月が……。
translation: Well, if that's the case, then what about Itsuki...

japanese:
（らいはがいるとは言え、
　俺とキャンプは五月としては嫌だろうしな）
translation:
(Even though Raiha is there,
 Itsuki probably would hate camping with me.)

japanese:
いえ、私なら大丈夫ですよ？
いいじゃないですか、キャンプ。
translation:
No, I'm fine with it, I suppose?
Camping sounds like fun.

japanese: ……そうか、お前がいいならいいが。
translation:
...Is that right.
If you're okay with it, then it's fine.

japanese:
ほらほら、お兄ちゃん、五月さん、
早くテントを張りに行こう！
急がないと日が暮れちゃうよ！
translation:
Come on, come on, big bro, Itsuki-san!
Let's hurry and set up the tent!
If we don't hurry, the sun will set!

japanese:
わっ！？
らいはちゃん、引っ張らないでください！
translation:
Wah?!
Raiha-chan, please don't yank on me!

japanese: ちょっと待て、らいは。
translation: Hold on, Raiha.

japanese: お兄ちゃん？
translation: Big bro?

japanese:
キャンプをやるのはいいが、
ちゃんと五月にも確認してから話を進めよう。
translation:
It's good that we're going camping,
but you need to check with Itsuki first
before we continue any further.
Huh...?

japanese: 五月さんなら……。
translation: What do you think, Itsuki-san...?

japanese:
私は、参加で構いませんよ？
キャンプも楽しそうですし。
translation:
I don't mind joining in.
Camping also sounds like fun.

japanese: ふふっ、だよね～！
translation: Teehee, I know, riiight?!

japanese:
……そうか。
お前がいいなら、俺からは何も言わないが。
translation:
...Is that right.
If you're okay with it, then I won't say anything.

japanese:
ほらほら、お兄ちゃん、五月さん、
早くテントを張りに行こう！
急がないと日が暮れちゃうよ！
translation:
Come on, come on, big bro, Itsuki-san!
Let's hurry and set up the tent!
If we don't hurry, the sun will set!

japanese:
わっ！？
らいはちゃん、引っ張らないでください！
translation:
Wah?!
Raiha-chan, please don't yank on me!

japanese:
らいはのやつ、そんなにキャンプが
したかったのなら、最初から言えばよかったのにな。
translation:
That Raiha.
If she really wanted to go camping,
she should have said so from the start.

japanese:
では上杉さん、楽しんできてくださいね？
どうぞ、テントです。
translation:
Well then, Uesugi-san, have fun, okay?
Here's the tent.

japanese: ああ、ありがとな。
translation: Yeah, thanks.

japanese:
（って、結構、重い……。
　これを倉庫から引っ張り出してきたのか）
translation:
(Man, this is pretty heavy...
 Did they pull this out of storage?)

japanese: あっ！　壊したら弁償ですからね？
translation:
Ah! If you break it,
you have to pay for it, okay?

japanese:
怖いこと言うな。
金額を考えただけで背筋が寒くなる。
translation:
Don't say such scary things.
Just thinking about the cost gives me chills.

japanese:
あはは、冗談ですよ。
では私はこれにて失礼しまーす！
translation:
Ahaha, just kidding.
Theeen, I'll get goin' now!

japanese:
（さて、俺も早く行くか。
　しかし本当に重いな、このテント……）
translation:
(Well, I should go too.
 But man, this tent is really heavy...)
